title: Apple Launches Six New Cases for the iPhone 7; Offers Fewer Apple Watch Bands Bundle Than Before
text:
Apple Launches Six New Cases for the iPhone 7; Offers Fewer Apple Watch Bands Bundle Than Before Posted by Chethan Rao on Mar 21, 2017 | No Comments Pin 1 Shares 95 
Apple has officially reduced the number of bands that you can choose from when you get a brand new Apple Watch Series 2. Previously available in Leather, Link or Silicone bands, the wearable is now only available in Milanese Loop, and Sport bands when you’re getting a brand new model. 
This has, in turn, increased the pricing of the leather, as well as link bands if you intend to purchase them separately. This comes freshly after the announcement of a few new watch bands as part of Apple’s Spring 2017 collection . 
Customers will now be able to get Sport bands in Pebble (Blue), Azure, and Camelia colors. Woven Nylon bands in Berry, Tahoe Blue, Orange, Red, Pollen, and Midnight Blue. Finally, the leather or Classic Buckle bands in Berry, Sapphire, and Taupe. The Nike Sport bands are now sold separately. 
Apple has also launched silicone and leather cases for the iPhone 7 and 7 Plus in the same colors, essentially offering a uniform lineup of colors among their cases. 
It’s clear that by reducing the number of bands that are available by default, Apple is making it less confusing for new buyers of the Apple Watch Series 2. It is also possible that Apple is only offering the two bands that are popular, or perhaps simply trying to make more money off of separate purchases.
